page.title: 08Middleton Hall.
page.content: Middleton Hall is a Grade 2 listed building,which was built around 1871 for John T.Leather.It is built of whinstone. The Hall is a very large house of very high proportions in 2 and 3 storeys with a basement,gables and mullioned and transomed windows with 4 centre lights.There is a gabled wing to the left with a large bay window.In the 1920's a sandstone wing in the same style was built to the right. Greenwich Hospital Estates purchased the Hall after World War 2 and it was then converted into 5 separate dwelling houses.The stable block was converted into 8 small houses and the school which was originally for estate workers children is now a dwelling house as is the estate fire station.
